snippet: The Chinese economy, after nearly three decades of rapid, almost uninterrupted growth, seems to be settling down.
abstract: Chinese economy, after nearly three decades of rapid, almost uninterrupted growth, seems to be settling down to a strong but less blistering pace; some sectors are struggling, including exports and luxury residential real estate construction; government has scaled back its economic growth target to 7.5 percent for 2012, down from 8 percent.
lead_paragraph: The Chinese economy, after nearly three decades of rapid, almost uninterrupted growth, seems to be settling down.

headline.seo: In China, Sobering Signs of Slower Growth
headline.main: In China, Sobering Signs of Slower Growth
